abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Dushanbe Water Supply
            Project for Tajikistan were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            substantial; Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory;
            and borrower performance was also moderately unsatisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: balancing infrastructure
            rehabilitation and service improvement emergencies with
            operating performance and institutional reform expectations.
            Need to tailor resources to implementation challenges.
            Don't wait to restructure projects with compromised
            outlook. The project should have been restructured, with
            relevant updates to the implementation arrangements and the
            results framework. Risk mitigation through conservative
            goal-setting and robust results framework.

repnme.cdata!:
Tajikistan - Additional Financing for the
            Dushanbe Water Supply Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Additional
            Financing (AF) for the Dushanbe Water Supply Project for
            Tajikistan is to improve the safety, reliability,
            efficiency, and financial viability of the water supply
            services in Dushanbe. The project was approved on June 18,
            2002 and it's AF on December 19, 2006. The AF included
            an 18-month extension of the closing date from June 30, 2007
            to December 31, 2008 to scale-up activities and enhance
            project impact. The project closing date was further
            extended in December 2008 by another 18 months to June 30,
            2010 in consideration of implementation delays caused by the
            extremely cold winter of 2008 and the time needed to provide
            opportunity to the implementing agency to get acquainted
            with the pilot water disinfection scheme by visiting
            operators in the region, re-design, re-bid and execute a
            major contract introducing a new pilot water disinfection scheme.

display_title.display_title:
Tajikistan - Additional Financing
            for the Dushanbe Water Supply Project : restructuring : Main report

The objective of the Additional
            Financing (AF) for the Dushanbe Water Supply Project for
            Tajikistan is to improve the safety, reliability,
            efficiency, and financial viability of the water supply
            services in Dushanbe. The project was approved on June 18,
            2002 and it's AF on December 19, 2006. The AF included
            an 18-month extension of the closing date from June 30, 2007
            to December 31, 2008 to scale-up activities and enhance
            project impact. The project closing date was further
            extended in December 2008 by another 18 months to June 30,
            2010 in consideration of implementation delays caused by the

            with the pilot water disinfection scheme by visiting
            operators in the region, re-design, re-bid and execute a
            major contract introducing a new pilot water disinfection scheme.
